website_summaries.verdict: The Merrell Burnt Rock Travel Suede has been highly praised for its comfortable construction and stylish good looks. With its excellent arch support and lightweight feel, the sneaker comes highly recommended by a few wearers. It's also been described as ideal everyday footwear.However, it should be noted that there are only a few colorways available. At its affordable price, this model from the Merrell sneaker line can be a good addition to any shoe lover’s collection.
pros: Most reviewers commend the Merrell Burnt Rock Travel Suede for being very comfortable
According to a couple of buyers, the shoe fulfills their expectations when it comes to Merrell casual sneakers
Many purchasers have observed that the sneaker looks stylish
The Merrell Burnt Rock Travel Suede is reasonably priced
A few buyers share that they will recommend this model
This shoe has good arch support, several wearers have lauded
Some users praise the Merrell Burnt Rock Travel Suede for being lightweight
More than a handful of commenters have perceived that the sneaker is ideal for wearing every day
cons: There are only a few color options for the Merrell Burnt Rock Travel Suede

customer_reviews.title: Total crap.
customer_reviews.text: I want to like these. They look cool, they’re comfortable. I’ve worn them for hours of walking around cities and on rough roads and they were great. However, within weeks of wearing them they’re already showing wear. The rubber trim pieces are peeling off. You can also see they were made cheaply, slightly asymmetric, just shoddy. Not what I expected from Merrel.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: These were true to my size for Merrell shoes. Problem with these is even though they are new they are feeling flimsy already. Now that I've broken them in I've noticed a bump or bulg in the foam/sole of the right shoe that is causes discomfort after wearing them for some time. Not a fan of flat laces anymore either. Overall I wouldn't buy these again, and may not keep them very long. Kind of disappointing. I really like my new Cham 7 wp Merrell though, those are great shoes... These not so much.
customer_reviews.author: T_woot

customer_reviews.title: Nice casual shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love them as casual shoes, but it is a stretch to call them hiking shoes. As another reviewer mentioned, the mesh seems to be fake mesh, so aside from being low-tops, these shoes do not vent heat that well; as casual shoes, no problem, but hiking in hot weather would not be the best. pros: look great light weight comfy cons: not great ventilation laces not the best Update 9/13/19: watch out on smooth floors during wet conditions. I found them to be like ice skates in stores and restaurants.
customer_reviews.author: The Green Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Trail Shoes
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable, it’s like sliding your foot into a baby seal! Great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the price
customer_reviews.text: I loved this shoe, and I will buy another one. i've read some reviews before buy it and some consumers had said that it wasn't strong enough. that's not true. this is very light version of the Merrell's. I've walked with this shoe about 17,000 steps a day in Paris for 5 days, and I am very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Reginaldo Parron

customer_reviews.title: Hiking Shoe with a Street Shoe Look
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that they have a ribbon type shoelace which stays tight. I chose these shoes because I was tired of the hiking and sneaker appearance and wanted something more dress looking which provided comfort. Glad Merrell seems to have expanded their designs.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Z

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe -- Merrell is always on point.
customer_reviews.text: These are a comfortable shoe and the fit was as expected. I wear these things a lot in the winter and have held up great (which is a trademark of Merrell). My only concern with these is the Rubber Strip at the toe of these, it hasn't yet become fully loose but I foresee this coming apart or off the shoe well before the rest of the shoe is wore out. Otherwise, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Cortney Copeland

customer_reviews.title: So lightweight & classy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these shoes for my husband for the summer. He has to walk a lot on hot asphalt parking lots. He was thrilled with this shoe. It is incredibly lightweight, which he loved. He has shoe inserts that he is not even going to use bc this shoe supports his arch and is super comfortable! He said they are like walking on air. And the design is so stylish without looking like a tennis shoe. His first time wearing Merrell and won't be his last! One of my favorite brands. This shoe is no longer being offered in this color on Merrell's website so was thrilled to find it on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: bam

customer_reviews.title: Shazaaam! Look great. So comfy. Fit
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these Merrells. I got them for travel so I could travel in them and use them in the gym (not running). They look real good and true to their heritage, so comfy!! I ordered another pair in different style and they just arrived. I’m gonna get one more in the leather sneaker. Super happy!
customer_reviews.author: R. G. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking not as comfortable standing.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe for walking. The arch support is designed for full support on and off the trail. I purchased this shoe for work where I have a split of walking on concrete and extended times of standing on concrete. I personally find the arch support uncomfortable when standing, but amazing when walking. Just something to keep in mind when purchasing: what’s the purpose of your shoe? I gave them a 4* instead of a 5* based solely on the shoe laces. I feel they are very thin and could break upon tying them up.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I like these.Very comfy for hiking and exploring around new cities and areas. I use them for travel. They have been to many countries. Hold up well and are super versatile. Look good with lots of different types of attire. Would definitely purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan N. Miles

customer_reviews.title: Urban hiker
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable right out of the box. Great support. Look great. Very pleased with purchase. I have had several pair of Merrell Hiking shoes for outdoor hiking and visiting National Parks. Bought these for more urban hiking/ walking vacations.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy S Longest

customer_reviews.title: The black rubber on the front is falling off after a month of casual wear
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are comfortable, but I don't like the white rubber on the bottom because mud doesn't wash off easily. The black rubber on the front is starting to peel off after about a month of wearing them to the office. The laces are too long, but they're made of a thin/light-weight material that seems good. The back of the sole is pretty tall and looks weird. Like most other shoes, they have those annoying loops on the back of the sole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great looking “walking shoe.” This is not a hiking shoe. Difficult to keep fabric clean if you go off-trail. I broke these in at Disney...held up great, looked great and comfy with my arch supports. I’d buy again for a casual sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Manfred

customer_reviews.title: Size may vary
customer_reviews.text: I had to send the shoe back to get a half size smaller. Haven't received it yet so I don't know if it will be too small.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: really nice looking light weight shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice casual shoes. Comfortable and very light weight-- not great for extensive walking or hiking but fine for travel or casual use. I like the gray color a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Too large.
customer_reviews.text: Normally I wear size 11 shoes, and sometimes 10.5, but 10.5 are usually snug. These 10.5 shoes had my foot moving inside them quite a bit. Also, they look like they have a ventilation layer but its a fake vent on the sides. The shoe runs very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Preet

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable, Not a Hiking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ahead of a trip where I knew I would be doing a lot of walking (both city and mild hiking). These shoes are very comfortable and provide a lot of support. However, there is little to no grip on these things. Did a hike near a waterfall and it was like I was walking on ice. Regardless, they met their need and provided a very comfortable shoe for city walking and like hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Gocowboys

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Appearance was fine although materials seemed somewhat cheap. Runs large as others have reported. The fit, especially of the right shoe was defective. The shoe wobbled as if the last of the sole was deformed. The difference between the left and right shoe was easily visible when placed together on a flat surface. Very disappointing from a manufacturer such as Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: OlderWiser

customer_reviews.title: Burnt Rock Travel Shoes are Great
customer_reviews.text: I love my Burnt Rock Travel shoes. I purchased the grey version and absolutely love them. I am looking into buying another color, because they are that good.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I bought these for a vacation to Tokyo .We walked several miles everyday and these shoes felt great and look good (enough). A great combination of function and style.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Zale

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like them
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fit well and look fine. Problem was when I walked the shoe folded and cut across by left big toe. So I'll be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and comfortable, great to wear all the time. I’m sold on Merrell shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is comfortable feels light in an unsubstantial way like low quality. Rubber on front of shoe started peeling off within days of wearing. Superglue works but only lasts a little while. This shoe just seem low quality all around not like other merrells I’ve had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Machlitt

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but too much arch support
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is a great quality shoe but it has too much arch support for my feet, as I have little to no arches.
customer_reviews.author: W. White

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE AND STYLISH
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE SEVERAL PAIRS OF THESE SUEDE SNEAKERS. THEY ARE THE PERFECT SHOE FOR CASUAL WALKING, JEANS, KHAKIS AND CORDS.
customer_reviews.author: maturestyle

customer_reviews.title: Great travel shoe
customer_reviews.text: Just wore these in Germany, Switzerland and Italy for 7 days. Comfortable and was a bit dressier than a hiking shoe just as I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Fits
customer_reviews.text: Toe a little tight for me but all in all ok. It works. Good looks too.
customer_reviews.author: Skink

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit
customer_reviews.text: It runs a little small and lacks proper arch support
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Too much arch support.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe arrived the other day and while it looks and feels to be well made, the arch support was much too pronounced for me and was uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip James Luman

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: As has been said, the similarities between slipping on this shoe and sliding your foot inside a baby seal are remarkable. 5/7 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking all day
customer_reviews.text: Color was the only one left, but the shoe is great
customer_reviews.author: margaret

customer_reviews.title: Nice warm weather hiker.
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes 8 hours right out of the box and I loved them. I also sprayed them with water protectant.
customer_reviews.author: dwolf

customer_reviews.title: Not snow shoes
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 12 but these shoes an 11 1/2 fit better
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan W.

customer_reviews.title: Good walking/ work shoe
customer_reviews.text: I work 12 hours a day as a carpenter and I love them. Work well and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stiffer than other Merrill’s. That’s good
customer_reviews.text: I liked this shoe. Great for hiking and biking. Look cool too
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Nice looks but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed with the quality as the sole started to come off after about three months of light use.
customer_reviews.author: J. will

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes arrived a lot earlier than I thought and I love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa  Willis

product_meta.title: Merrell mens J002119-10.0 Burnt Rock Travel Suede
product_meta.description: Switch from trails to sidewalks to indoor malls with the Merrell® Burnt Rock Travel Suede shoe. Suede leather upper with tough canvas panels. Traditional lace closure. Breathable mesh lining. Protective rubber toe cap. Kinetic Fit™ removable contoured insole for flexible support. EVA midsole for agility and stability on uneven terrain. M Select™ GRIP outsole with anatomical grooves is sticky and durable for superior grip and traction on wet or dry trails. Imported. Measurements: Weight: 12 oz Product measurements were taken using size 12, width M. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: M Select GRIP outsole tunes each outsole with durable traction that grips when and where you need it
Kinetic Fit Base removable contoured insole for flexible support
